Tasks.Task Description: Continuously monitor the connectivity status of IoT devices registered in Azure IoT Central. Investigate and resolve any connectivity issues promptly.
Verify the security settings for devices, including authentication methods and encryption protocols. Ensure compliance with organizational security policies.
Review and update device templates to reflect changes in device capabilities or requirements. Ensure templates are aligned with current operational needs.
Validate the integrity of data received from IoT devices. Identify and address any anomalies or inconsistencies in the data.
Test failover mechanisms to ensure high availability and resilience of the IoT Central application in case of service disruptions.
Review and audit user access permissions to ensure only authorized personnel have access to IoT Central resources.
Analyze device performance metrics and implement optimizations to improve efficiency and reduce latency.
Regularly back up configuration data for IoT Central, including device templates, rules, and settings. Store backups securely for restoration purposes.
Analyze application metrics to ensure the IoT Central application is operating within expected parameters. Address any performance deviations.
Review and update security policies for IoT Central to adapt to evolving threats and ensure compliance with industry standards.
Keep IoT Central documentation up-to-date, including operational procedures, device templates, and troubleshooting guides.
Conduct incident response drills to prepare the team for potential security incidents or IoT Central application outages.
Perform regular compliance checks to ensure the IoT Central setup adheres to relevant regulations and industry standards.
Collect and analyze user feedback regarding IoT Central performance and reliability. Implement continuous improvements based on this feedback.
